page.title: 06ECOLOGY IN PAXFORD AREA (2)
page.content: Verges support grasses and broadleaved plants including dock,cowparsley, nettles,thistles,convulvulous,hogweed, meadowsweet,clover,tufted-vetch,mallow rosebay willowherb,and sorrel. Mechanically cut hedges have become thick topped.Others grow unrestricted. They contain hawthorn,brambles,hazel, elderberry,blackthorn and standing trees including oak,ash and willow.In S.W.corner of area 0.1sq.m.of woodland supports dense broadleaved trees such as sycamore,chestnut,oak ash,dogwood, crabapple,blackthorn and hazel. 2.5km. of borber strip at thicket stage around a plantation contains dogrose, hawthorn,blackthorn,honeysuckle, bramble and rich ground flora.Fauna include small mammals,rabbits,hares, badgers and deer.Besides songbirds, gamebirds and birds of prey,swans, geese and herons may be seen.
